comments:
From a new workspace...
1. File -> Import... -> Log File.
2. Click on the "Add..." button.
3. Click on the details tab, then the "Browse..." button.
4. Locate an Apache HTTP Server access log (e.g. use the one in the examples) 
and click ok.
5. Back in the "Add Log File" dialog, click ok.

Nothing will happen, and the "Add Log File" dialog doesn't go away. You'll get 
the following in the console...
Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
Index out of bounds

If you look in the .log file, you will find the following...

!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

I found a workaround for this problem...

Populate the default logset on the windows driver, then 
copy .metadata/org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui/pref_store.ini from the windows 
workspace to the corresponding location on the linux workspace.
Then, start Eclipse.

Since the logset has already been populated with the logs that you wish to 
import, you won't have to bring up the "Add Log File" dialog, thus avoiding 
this error.
Couldn't reproduce the problem with M8-gtk+hyades.runtime3.0_20040412_1623.

We've gone through the M9 test pass twice, and if someone's run into this 
problem again, we would've known by now.

Closing bug...
